description: Returns information about the TLS certificates that are associated with the specified Lightsail load balancer. TLS is just an updated, more secure version of Secure Socket Layer (SSL). You can have a maximum of 2 certificates associated with a Lightsail load balancer. One is active and the other is inactive.

parameters.name: loadBalancerName
parameters.description: The name of the load balancer you associated with your SSL/TLS certificate.

nested_items.name: tlsCertificates
nested_items.description: An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificate objects describing your SSL/TLS certificates.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the SSL/TLS certificate ( my-certificate).

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SSL/TLS certificate.

nested_items.name: supportCode
nested_items.description: The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have questions about your Lightsail load balancer or SSL/TLS certificate. This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The time when you created your SSL/TLS certificate.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The resource type ( LoadBalancerTlsCertificate).
Instance - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private server)
StaticIp - A static IP address.
KeyPair - The key pair used to connect to a Lightsail instance.
InstanceSnapshot - A Lightsail instance snapshot.
Domain - A DNS zone.
PeeredVpc - A peered VPC.
LoadBalancer - A Lightsail load balancer.
LoadBalancerTlsCertificate - An SSL/TLS certificate associated with a Lightsail load balancer.
Disk - A Lightsail block storage disk.
DiskSnapshot - A block storage disk snapshot.

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: loadBalancerName
nested_items.description: The load balancer name where your SSL/TLS certificate is attached.

nested_items.name: isAttached
nested_items.description: When true, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the Lightsail load balancer.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The validation status of the SSL/TLS certificate. Valid values are below.

nested_items.name: domainName
nested_items.description: The domain name for your SSL/TLS certificate.

nested_items.name: domainValidationRecords
nested_items.description: An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord objects describing the records.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: A fully qualified domain name in the certificate. For example, example.com.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of validation record. For example, CNAME for domain validation.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value for that type.

nested_items.name: validationStatus
nested_items.description: The validation status. Valid values are listed below.

nested_items.name: domainName
nested_items.description: The domain name against which your SSL/TLS certificate was validated.

nested_items.name: dnsRecordCreationState
nested_items.description: An object that describes the state of the canonical name (CNAME) records that are automatically added by Lightsail to the DNS of a domain to validate domain ownership.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The status code for the automated DNS record creation.
SUCCEEDED - The validation records were successfully added.
STARTED - The automatic DNS record creation has started.
FAILED - The validation record addition failed.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The message that describes the reason for the status code.

nested_items.name: failureReason
nested_items.description: The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS - This failure applies to email validation, which is not available for Lightsail certificates.

ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED - Lightsail requires additional information to process this certificate request. This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required information, use the AWS Support Center to contact AWS Support.

nested_items.name: issuedAt
nested_items.description: The time when the SSL/TLS certificate was issued.

nested_items.name: issuer
nested_items.description: The issuer of the certificate.

nested_items.name: keyAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private key).

nested_items.name: notAfter
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate expires.

nested_items.name: notBefore
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate is first valid.

nested_items.name: renewalSummary
nested_items.description: An object that describes the status of the certificate renewal managed by Lightsail.

nested_items.name: renewalStatus
nested_items.description: The renewal status of the certificate.
PendingAutoRenewal - Lightsail is attempting to automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further action is required.

PendingValidation - Lightsail couldn't automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate. You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your certificate remains in use.
Success - All domain names in the certificate are validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is required.
Failed - One or more domain names were not validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the CreateCertificate action.

nested_items.name: domainValidationOptions
nested_items.description: Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the RequestCertificate request.

nested_items.name: domainName
nested_items.description: The fully qualified domain name in the certificate request.

nested_items.name: validationStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the domain validation. Valid values are listed below.

nested_items.name: revocationReason
nested_items.description: The reason the certificate was revoked. This value is present only when the certificate status is REVOKED.

nested_items.name: revokedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present only when the certificate status is REVOKED.

nested_items.name: serial
nested_items.description: The serial number of the certificate.

nested_items.name: signatureAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The algorithm that was used to sign the certificate.

nested_items.name: subject
nested_items.description: The name of the entity that is associated with the public key contained in the certificate.

nested_items.name: subjectAlternativeNames
nested_items.description: An array of strings that specify the alternate domains ( example2.com) and subdomains ( blog.example.com) for the certificate.
(string) ---
